intro: Graffenrieda stellipilis, commonly known as the star-pilose graffenrieda, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Graffenrieda stellipilis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
